[2 `r r2dii.dataraw::degrees()` Investing Initiative](https://2degrees-investing.org/) (2dii) maintains a collection or R packages called r2dii. To help you install and use all those packages at once, we also built the r2dii (meta) package. The r2dii package is the only package most users need to know about. Contact us if you need more details.

Features:

* Functions to access raw or lightly-prepared data. This allows you to access "live" data from 2dii's dropbox folder and to take a snapshot of it.

## Installation

To minimize installation errors, ensure your R environment is as follows:

* R version is recent.
* All packages are updated (run `update.packages()`; maybe use `ask = FALSE`).
* No other R session is running.
* Current R session is clean (click *Session \> Restart R*).

Install the development version of r2dii with:

```r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("2DegreesInvesting/r2dii")
```

## Example

These examples provide a high level overview of the main features. For more details see [Get started](articles/r2dii.html).

Attaching r2dii automatically attaches other r2dii packages.

```{r example}
library(r2dii)
```

### Creating snapshots

`take_snapshot()` snapshots all possible datasets, using a default configuration file, a default destination directory, and does not overwrite existing snapshots.

```{r}
take_snapshot()
```

Use:

* `datasets` to snapshot specific datasets.
* `overwrite = TRUE` to overwrite existing snapshots.

```{r}
datasets <- c("RevenueSplit", "EQMarket.Size")

datasets %>% 
  take_snapshot(overwrite = TRUE)
```

Use `destdir` to customize the destination directory.

```{r}
datasets %>% 
  take_snapshot(overwrite = TRUE)
```

Use `config` to provide a custom configuration file to `take_snapshot()`.

```{r}
custom_config <- example_config("config-toy.yml")
custom_config

custom_config %>% 
  show_config()

"DebtMarketClimate" %>% 
  take_snapshot(destdir = tempdir(), overwrite = TRUE, config = custom_config)
```

* `options(r2dii.dataraw_config = <custom_config>)` does the same but affects your R session globally.

```{r}
restore <- options(r2dii.dataraw_config = custom_config)

"DebtMarketClimate" %>% 
  take_snapshot(destdir = tempdir(), overwrite = TRUE)
get_config()

options(restore)
get_config()
```

See also `?edit_config()` to edit the default configuration file.
